result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 14CF1188

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 14CF1188

miscConds.notes: Report to Racine Vocational Ministry once released. Report to Fatherhood Program at YMCA. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.	 Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
